title: When Hearts Break and Wallets Empty
plot_outline: Patty LaHam's carefully constructed solitude is disrupted when they're forced to interact with another mascot having a breakdown. As authority figure abuses power, both characters must confront their issues with trust, intimacy, and the fact that misery loves company.

scenes.title: Rock Bottom Has a Basement
scenes.action: Patty LaHam begins their day with the usual routine of avoiding responsibility and managing expectations. The catalyst for today's adventure presents itself in the form of an overdue bill. Despite every instinct screaming "don't get involved," circumstances and poor judgment combine to draw Patty LaHam into the situation.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: I have a bad feeling about this.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: This is not what I signed up for.

dialogue.speaker: Dumbo
dialogue.line: Why do I let myself get talked into these things?
dialogue.tone: defeated resignation with occasional flashes of frustrated energy

visual_details.setting_description: A place where life happens to people who've stopped trying to control it

character_appearances.Patty LaHam: undefined, rhinestone tiara, fake eyelashes, flask of gin, showing signs of financial stress
character_appearances.Eddie the Pawn Shop Owner: Tired, worn down, but still clinging to whatever dignity remains
character_appearances.Dumbo: droopy, bloodshot, crusty pizza slice, stained remote control, empty beer cans, showing signs of recent poor decisions

visual_details.environmental_details: Spinning cycles of futility, industrial detergent, and late-night confessions
visual_details.mood_lighting: The kind of lighting that makes everyone look like they've made poor life choices

scenes.title: When Bad Gets Worse
scenes.action: The situation escalates when a misunderstanding escalates out of control. What seemed like a manageable problem reveals itself to be connected to larger issues involving medical malpractice. Patty LaHam realizes they're in deeper than anticipated and that their usual strategy of "ignore it and hope it goes away" won't work this time.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: I have a bad feeling about this.
dialogue.subtext: revealing more about their pain than intended

dialogue.speaker: Eddie the Pawn Shop Owner
dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.

dialogue.speaker: Eddie the Pawn Shop Owner
dialogue.line: That went about as well as expected.
dialogue.subtext: testing whether this person can be trusted

scenes.title: Same Shit, Different Day
scenes.action: The episode concludes with Patty LaHam having learned nothing from their experience but somehow finding themselves in a slightly different variation of the same situation they started in. Victory is redefined as "not making things significantly worse," and the audience is reminded that some problems don't get solved—they just get replaced with new problems.

dialogue.speaker: Patty LaHam
dialogue.line: I have a bad feeling about this.
dialogue.subtext: testing whether this person can be trusted

dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.
